column3: Run, walk, bike or take in a baseball game. Lots to do and plenty of parking available. They even have dog obedience classes going on which we found fun to watch.
Even if you don't go to see some college baseball stop by to see them honor the iconic Jakie Robinson with a statue and plaque of his legacy and time at UCLA

column2: What a great place to watch a great game
column3: College baseball is just about the best way to enjoy the sport. At Jackie Robinson stadium you are within get of the field. The is easy parking and god food. The kids gave a great time. Enjoy the game and watch future stars or just great college players and relax .

column2: A Baseball island in West Los Angeles
column3: If you love baseball, then a visit to any NCAA ball park is good for the soul. jackie Robinson Stadium is located int he heart of West LA right next to the 405 freeway but, you would never know that whilst at a game. Games here are pastoral in the midst of the big city.
